str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
From eu and phren; to put in a good frame of mind, i.e. Rejoice.
A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
